meanings.definition: The amount that a pot can hold.
meanings.sent1: She poured potfuls of water into the boiling pot.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for two potfuls of sugar.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled potfuls of flour all over the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with potfuls of colorful flowers, creating a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The children eagerly collected potfuls of seashells along the shore.

meanings.sent1: The shelves were lined with potfuls of spices and herbs.
meanings.sent2: The market sold various potfuls of jams and preserves.
meanings.sent3: The picnic basket was filled with potfuls of sandwiches for the outing.
meanings.sent4: The treasure chest was overflowing with potfuls of gold coins.
meanings.sent5: The warehouse stored potfuls of goods ready for shipment.
